description.hltext_display: 2010年12月22日国债到期收益率
Avatar Is 2010's Most Pirated Film
description.content:
AVATAR has been named the most pirated film of 2010.
James Cameron's sci-fi epic - the most successful film of all time with gross takings of $2.7 billion - was downloaded illegally 16.6 million times, according to TorrentFreak.com.
Kick-Ass was second with 11.4 million downloads and Leonardo DiCaprio's films Inception and Shutter Island were third and fourth respectively.

description.hltext_display: Plenty of sports stars in sex scandals during 2010
description.content:
While 2010 saw plenty of sporting success on the field, once again there was no shortage of stars making headlines off field for all the wrong reasons.
Players from a diverse range of sports including football, AFL, NRL, American football - not to mention golf - got into a variety of sticky situations this year, with some having past exploits in their personal lives aired for the very first time.
Once these dodgy dalliances bubbled to the surface, it became messy, very messy. Marriages were shattered, lucrative endorsement deals were flushed down the toilet and clubs could no longer hold onto players who had stuffed up in very big ways.
Leading the pack was champion golfer Tiger Woods, who hit the spotlight for reasons other than winning yet another tournament late last year. The ongoing saga of his dalliances with more than 100 women kept newspapers selling and mouses clicking well into this year.
Some superstars couldn't keep their fingers to themselves as texting became all the rage for athletes looking for a bit of extra-curricular activity outside the family mansion.
And football stars messing with teammates or ex-teammates missuses? C'mon, have they never heard of a bloke called Wayne Carey?
The flipside of fame means things don't stay secret for long for people constantly in the gaze of the public eye. Eventually the details emerge, presenting mouth-watering fodder for the public at home and overseas.
Here's nine of the best sporting scandals:
1. Tiger Woods
It seemed to go downhill for the world's first billionaire sportsman when he arrived in Melbourne for last year's Australian Masters tournament. American tabloid The National Enquirer reported prominent New York nightclub hostess Rachel Uchitel had flown into Australia to pay Woods a visit while he was staying at the Crown hotel. In early December, Woods infamously crashed his car outside his Florida home after a falling-out with his wife Elin Nordegren, the mother of his two children, allegedly provoked when the alleged affairs were being "discussed". Soon after, other magazines named two more women - a Los Angeles cocktail waitress and a Las Vegas club promoter - as having regular flings with the world's best golfer.
Then more and more names came forward, and in April this year, The National Enquirer reported Woods as having confessed to cheating with as many as 120 women behind his wife's back during their five-year marriage. The golfer was said to have listed all the women he had liaisons with as part of his treatment for sex addiction at a Mississippi rehab centre.
In October, the pair finally divorced, with Nordegren reportedly receiving a $US100 million settlement from 33-year-old Woods. The golfer - who went through 2010 without a tournament win and lost his coveted world No.1 ranking to Lee Westwood - also lost $US22 million in endorsements after AT&T, Gatorade and Accenture, among others, pulled out after learning of his prowess at scoring birdies away from the golf course.
2. Joel Monaghan
The former Canberra Raiders centre landed in hot water after a photograph of him engaging in a lewd act with a dog in some end-of-season shenanigans surfaced on the internet.
The 28-year-old quit the NRL team and couldn't contain his emotions during the announcement. "I don't want to damage this great club anymore because of this stupid prank," he said. "They're my actions and I'm totally responsible. Alcohol is no excuse. I'd love more than anything to take it back but I can't."
Of course you can't Joel, who expects to cop no shortage of flak when he makes his English Super League debut next year for Warrington.
"All that nonsense that went on in Australia is water under the bridge as far as we're concerned," Monaghan's new captain Adrian Morley said.
Good luck telling that to the fans in England - it is likely there will be many more dog days ahead for this fallen star.
3. Brendan Fevola
Not an AFL (Aussie Rules) season goes by when Brisbane Lions spearhead Brendan Fevola doesn't find himself in a pickle.
This time around alcohol wasn't to blame, but instead a brainless decision by Fevola to take a nude shower photograph of model Lara Bingle back in 2006 during their brief affair.
The pic came to light this year and landed him in big trouble, again, with the AFL. It also played a part in Bingle's eventual split with the vice-captain of the Australian Test team, Michael Clarke.
The former Carlton forward admitted he took the offending picture but the League said it could not be proved he was responsible for its distribution around the traps.
Still, the neanderthal behaviour of Fev sent another wrecking ball through the AFL's battle plans to present itself and its players as a "female friendly", modern sporting code.
4. Shane Warne
Fresh reports of a fling between Shane Warne and English supermodel Liz Hurley came to light in recent weeks, pouring cold water on the much peddled rumour Warnie was being sized up as a replacement captain to save the struggling Australian Test team.
Not for the first time, Warne's so-called bedroom antics have cost him. Previous indiscretions during his playing career saw him stripped of the Test vice-captaincy in 2000 and miss out on becoming the captain of the one-day team in 2002. His Channel Nine contract was also ripped up in 2005.
Questions are now being asked about the status of Hurley's marriage to Indian tycoon Arun Nayar, even though the actress wrote on Twitter that they separated a "few months ago".
The UK tabloid News of the World claimed the Hurley and Warne were captured on video in a series of ''sizzling public clinches'', while Warne had been flirting with Hurley via Twitter for months.
According to "trusty" sources, the tabloid claimed the online tomfoolery with Hurley happened well after he and on-again, off-again wife Simone Callahan had separated - despite them living under the same roof but in separate bedrooms of their plush suburban Melbourne home.
5. Ashley Cole
Like many before and after him, the Chelsea and England defender is an absolute nutter.
A stunning pop star wife in the form of Cheryl Cole beside him wasn't enough for Ashley, who instead preferred to engage in some "text sex" with a topless model.
The scandal for the Coles occurred early this year when a model Sonia Wild, 28, claimed to have received nude pictures of the Chelsea defender along with suggestive text messages.
Media reports said she replied with naked images of herself and claims she had "text sex" with the player.
This came just two years after Ashley had an affair with a hairdresser, along with numerous other women.
It seems this guy doesn't learn, with a divorce settlement figure of 4.5 million to the singer being bandied about recently.
6. Wayne Rooney
Tabloids went into overdrive when it was claimed Wayne Rooney was cavorting with a 1000-a-night prostitute while his wife Coleen was pregnant with their son, Kai.
The Mirror newspaper claimed the Manchester United striker was using the services of a 21-year-old call girl and even went as far as wheeling her out to VIP events throughout Manchester.
Rooney's marriage is now on the rocks, especially after Coleen - his childhood sweetheart - welcomed him back in 2004 after the same paper exposed him not once, but twice, for cheating on her with prostitutes.
Once bitten, twice shy. Fat chance.
7. John Terry
A year after being named "Dad of the Year" in a poll of UK adults that was commissioned by a ketchup company, Chelsea and ex-England captain John Terry didn't seem to have embraced the honour after it was revealed he slept with the now ex-girlfriend of his England teammate.
In January this year, Terry lost a court battle to keep secret the four-month affair in late 2009 with French lingerie model and his wife's best friend, Vanessa Perroncel.
Terry, 29, who is married with three-year-old twins, was stripped of the England captaincy ahead of this year's World Cup after the claims he had a fling with the then-girlfriend of Wayne Bridge became public.
Bridge and Terry were once teammates at Chelsea, but the former joined Manchester City last year. During their first meeting after the scandal broke, Terry thrust out a hand for the customary pre-game shake only to be spectacularly snubbed by Bridge in a photo that made front pages worldwide.
8. Brett Favre
The legendary NFL quarterback has not uttered a single word this year about the alleged nude pics of himself that he sent to a former New York Jets game hostess back in 2008.
The married Favre, who now plays for the Minnesota Vikings, has preferred to concentrate on his football and not get bogged down in the controversy surrounding the alleged messages and inappropriate photos he sent to Jenn Sterger in 2008 - the 41-year-old's only season with the Jets.
Favre could be spared the litigation if the NFL decides to punish Favre over the allegations, Sterger's manager has said.
Sterger wants the matter dealt with by the time Favre retires at the end of the year, as apparently her main objective is to get acknowledgement that the former Green Bay Packers star was in the wrong.
9. Tony Parker
Winning several NBA championships with the talented San Antonio Spurs and having a gorgeous wife in Desperate Housewives actress Eva Longoria to boot just simply wasn't enough for French basketball star Tony Parker.
Longoria last month filed for divorce after she found text messages Parker exchanged with the wife of former Spurs teammate, Brent Barry, according to TMZ.
"It was flirtatious, but he never did anything with her," a source close to Parker told People magazine.
TMZ reported Parker had also denied having had sex with Erin Barry, but that didn't stop Longoria from filing divorce papers at an LA court - citing "irreconcilable differences".
What's that they say in basketball circles ... "Reeeee-jected!"
Next Sport story: Sport Homepage

description.hltext_display: 2010年12月22日企业债到期收益率
Review: Microsoft Xbox Kinect
description.content:
Microsoft's motion controller for Xbox is the most revolutionary system yet, with depth-sensing, tracking of finger gestures and voice recognition. But is it worth the extra wodge?
The main RGB sensor scans the room at 30fps with 640x480 resolution. That's good enough to track arm and leg movements and can even spot more delicate stuff such as facial expressions and finger gestures, though only just. At the moment there are no games that put the low-res video feed on to the full screen, but any that do are likely to look chunky or grainy (as with PlayStation Move).
An infra-red projector and infra-red CMOS camera track your proximity to the screen. They operate at a lower resolution ByYatish Suvarna of 320x240, but still at 30fps. This allows the system to track your limbs, head and body as you move towards or away from the screen, and to mimic your real-life kicking and throwing movements with your onscreen avatar.
The most startling thing about Kinect is its motorised, pivoting neck. This gives it a certain "wow!" factor from the off, as it automatically adjusts itself to face you and droops like a sad robot when you turn it off. Setting up is just a matter of placing it on top of the TV and plugging it into the Xbox.
As well as the cameras, the Kinect unit conceals an array of microphones that are used for issuing voice commands. Speech recognition is remarkably successful, even with some really strong regional accents that would befuddle most of the other systems. Clapping and stamping can also be used as forms of input on some of the games.

description.hltext_display: LAN firms up commitment to order 50 A320 Family aircraft
description.content:
LAN Airlines, one of Latin America’s leading passenger and cargo airlines, signed a firm order for 50 new eco-efficient Airbus A320 Family aircraft, making it the largest single airline order for Airbus in Latin America.
Initially announced as a Memorandum of Understanding at the Farnborough International Airshow in July, the airline’s request for incremental A320 Family aircraft is part of LAN’s growth strategy for Latin America, serving as new and replacement aircraft for both existing and new routes. LAN has also selected Sharklets for the A320 that start being delivered in 2013.
Sharklets are large wing-tip devices that will enhance the eco-efficiency and payload-range performance of the A320 Family. They are expected to result up to 3.5 percent reduced fuel burn over longer sectors corresponding to an annual reduction of up to 700 metric tons of carbon dioxide per aircraft. This latest development is part of a larger, continuous-improvement program for the A320 Family. The order also includes 10 A321s, a new aircraft type for the airline.
Ignacio Cueto, LAN Airlines’ Chief Operating Officer, commented: “Since 2008, our short haul fleet has been entirely composed by Airbus A320-Family aircraft. Through this agreement, we confirm LAN’s commitment to the development of commercial aviation in Latin America by carefully selecting our aircraft based on its ability to effectively and efficiently serve our short- and long-haul flight needs.”
As of today, LAN’s total Airbus orders exceed 150, with more than 60 aircraft in passenger operations today throughout Chile, Argentina, Peru and Ecuador.
“We are extremely pleased with LAN’s continued confidence in Airbus and greatly appreciate the partnership established with LAN over the past 12 years,” said John Leahy, Airbus Chief Operating Officer Customers. “The A320 family is recognized as being the most modern and efficient single-aisle aircraft around and, through ongoing investments, the best continuously keeps getting better.”
With more than 550 aircraft sold and a record backlog of more than 250 aircraft to be delivered to its Latin American customers, today more than 300 Airbus aircraft are flying with 22 Latin American airline customers and operators, representing more than 40 percent of the fleet in service in the region.
The A320 Family (A318, A319, A320 and A321) is recognized as the benchmark single-aisle aircraft family. With 6800 aircraft sold, and more than 4,400 aircraft delivered to some 310 customers and operators worldwide, the A320 Family is the world’s best-selling single-aisle aircraft family. With 99.7 per cent reliability and extended servicing periods, the A320 Family has the lowest operating costs of any single aisle aircraft. Uniquely, the A320 Family offers a containerized cargo system, which is compatible with the worldwide standard wide-body system.

description.hltext_display: Natalie Portman - Portman's Big Cover Up As Thong Scene Is Doctored
description.content:
NATALIE PORTMAN's bottom has been covered up in the trailer for her new movie YOUR HIGHNESS - so the teaser can screen for under-18s.
The actress appears in a thong in the R-rated trailer but studio bosses feared the butt-baring scene would be too much for censors, so they've toned it down - and painted on panties.
Editors at EW.com have exposed the truth by airing both scenes online.
A source close to the production tells the website, "The scene was altered so the MPAA would approve the trailer for screening for appropriate audiences in theatres."
The thong scene will be replaced for the actual film.

description.hltext_display: 商务部部长：明年将完善铁矿石联合谈判机制
description.author: www.qq.com
description.content:
中新网12月22日电 据商务部网站消息，商务部部长陈德铭22日在2010年全国商务工作会议上强调指出，2011年要积极扩大进口，完善铁矿石和钾肥联合谈判机制。
12月22日，商务部部长陈德铭在2010年全国商务工作会议上强调指出，2011年既要看到应对国际金融危机一揽子计划带来的积极变化和继续推进科学发展的有利条件，又要充分认识到内外部环境的复杂性和严峻性，在新的起点上把商务工作做得更好。
陈德铭提出，2011年商务工作要深入落实科学发展观，加快商务领域结构调整和发展方式转变，进一步提升对外开放水平，着力构建搞活流通扩大消费长效机制，保障市场平稳运行，着力培育参与国际合作和竞争新优势，促进国际收支基本平衡，巩固和扩大应对国际金融危机冲击成果，保持国内外贸易和国际经济合作平稳较快发展，努力实现“十二五”的良好开局。
陈德铭表示，要积极扩大进口，完善进口促进政策，进一步简化进口管理措施，支持扩大进口，促进贸易平衡。适应国内结构调整和产业升级需要，扩大先进技术设备和关键零部件进口，推动企业技术改造。进一步拓宽粮棉等大宗商品进口渠道，便利企业及时根据国内外市场变化组织进口，缓解国内供应压力。举办进口商品展览会，提升广交会等大型展会的进口促进功能。针对重点商品建立政府、行业组织和企业进口协调机制，加强宏观调控和指导，完善铁矿石和钾肥联合谈判机制。继续推动发达国家放宽对我高技术出口管制。

description.hltext_display: HO! HO! HO! SANTA CLAUSE BROUGHT ELECTRIC CARS TO BOUCHERVILLE, QUEBEC, CANADA THIS YEAR!
description.content:
Gentle readers of this American Chronicle, all I wanted for Christmas for the last Ten years, was an Electric Zero Emissions vehicle. This year Santa is getting closer and closer to where I live! Maybe if I leave him Milk and Cookies he will park a new Mitsubishi Electric Car in my drive-way??..>
Mitsubishi and Hydro-Quebec launch largest electric-car test in Canada
Bookmark this site: http://autos.sympatico.ca/auto-news/7248/mitsubishi-and-hydro-quebec-launch-largest-electric-car-test-in-canada.
Mitsubishi and Hydro-Quebec launch largest electric-car test in Canada
Mitsubishi Canada and Hydro-Quebec have teamed up to launch the largest electric-car test program in Canada.
Boucherville, Quebec will host five of the all-electric Mitsubishi i-MiEVs. The cars arrived in the town and are currently being prepared for their new drivers.
The Mayor of Boucherbille, Jean Martel, is excited to be driving an i-MiEV. "By participating in this project, I feel I'm contributing to technological progress that will enable all of us to live in a cleaner world and breathe healthier air," he said.
Eventually, there will be 50 of the EVs in the province with Hydro-Quebec leading the road tests. They're looking to find out how the cars perform in the winter, as well as peoples' charging habits and overall satisfaction with the cars. Hybdro-Quebec is also particularly interested in how the vehicles will effect the electricity grid and what kind of infrastructure would be needed to support EVs.
A larger rollout of i-MiEVs will begin with the start of the second phase in Jan. 2011.

event_or_fact.property: By participating in this project, I feel I'm contributing to technological progress that will enable all of us to live in a cleaner world and breathe healthier air

description.hltext_display: Tricky conditions set to test Sydney to Hobart fleet
description.content:
ANTHONY JOHNSON/Fairfax Media WEATHER: Sydney to Hobart racers can expect rough conditions this year but there will be no repeat of the horrendous weather conditions that led to the 1998 tragedy. Relevant offers Other sports Sydney to Hobart racers can expect rough conditions this year but there will be no repeat of the horrendous weather conditions that led to the 1998 tragedy, according to the Bureau of Meteorology (BOM).
Light winds are set to ease sailors out of Sydney Harbour when the race starts on Boxing Day, but a strong southerly front is forecast to hit the fleet as they begin the long trek down the east coast.
However, BOM spokesman Barry Hanstrum was confident of avoiding a similar scenario to that witnessed in 1998 when brutal winds wreaked havoc on the field of 115 boats.
In that race, six sailors died and just 44 yachts completed the race, but Hanstrum said this year's competitors are not in danger.
"There's certainly nothing in the weather pattern that is indicative of the ferocity of the winds in the 1998 race," Hanstrum told reporters.
"That was a very small intense low that actually moved through the race course."
On Boxing Day evening the winds are expected to pick up, with a 20-30 knot southerly set to cause some trouble for the leading crews.
The forecast headwinds will dampen any hopes that pre-race favourite Wild Oats XI may have had of breaking her own race record of one day, 18 hours, 40 minutes and 10 seconds set in 2005.
"When you're on the boat you're really just focussed on making the right decisions at the right time to get down there as best you can," said Wild Oats XI's navigator Ian Burns.
"The real challenge I think is (going to be) the first couple of nights and keeping the boat together.
"We'll be slowing down rather than trying to break any record, or even necessarily breaking our competition.
"For us it won't be a record-breaking year, I don't think, but it'll have its challenges."
Hanstrum said the toughest period of racing will likely start late on Monday night and continue through to Tuesday when the leading yachts will encounter winds of 30-40 knots approaching Bass Strait.
"I think that's likely to be the most testing period of the race, weather-wise," Hanstrum added.
"A combination of gale force winds and large seas, expected to be in the range of 4-5 metres ... it will be tough going." Next Other sports story: Sport Homepage

description.hltext_display: Larsson's Girlfriend Plans Tell-all Book
description.content:
The grieving girlfriend of late author STIEG LARSSON has written her own account of the months following the writer's death in 2004 - in an effort to stop journalists hounding her for secrets about her life with the Swedish author.
Eva Gabrielsson dated The Girl With The Dragon Tattoo author for 32 years and has been at war with the writer's father and brother over his post-death fortune since Larsson's mysterious death.
Tired of talking about her dispute with Joakim and Erland Larsson, she has decided to put her thoughts into words - and her book about the saga will hit stores next year (11).
She tells Rolling Stone magazine, "I am done with refuting things about Stieg, about me and what happened after he died. Therefore, I have written a book about it, and I hope that will be the end of all (the) lies and speculation."
Larsson died virtually penniless months before his Millennium trilogy of books turned him into one of the world's bestselling author.
The Larsson's offered Gabrielsson $2.6 million (£1.73 million) from her late boyfriend's estate but she refused the cash. The writer's brother, Joakim, tells the publication he has no idea what Gabrielsson wants.

description.hltext_display: Rio Linda-Elverta water agency fires general manager
description.author: bbranan@sacbee.com (Brad Branan
description.content:
The Rio Linda-Elverta Community Water District fired its general manager early Tuesday, creating more turnover in the troubled district.
Joseph Sherrill, who had held the job since Nov. 7, becomes the seventh general manager to leave the district in four years.
In that time, the district has been the subject of investigations by grand juries and the Sacramento County District Attorney's Office. The state has twice issued orders to fix the system serving 15,000 customers and questioned the safety of its water.
Sherrill's dismissal generated a lot of dispute among district board members. They split 3-2 on the vote, according to board members, who made the decision behind closed doors about 2 a.m. Tuesday, at the end of a seven-hour meeting.
Members voting for his ouster had joined the board just after Sherrill's hiring. Frank Caron, his daughter Courtney Caron, and Martin Smith formed a new majority on the board last month.
Courtney and Frank Caron declined to discuss Sherrill's firing, except to say that he was dismissed for cause. Smith provided a list of reasons he said were read to Sherrill during the meeting.
The list contains three allegations: Sherrill threatened Smith; Sherrill failed to perform secretarial duties during a board meeting; and he subjected district employees to a hostile environment.
Sherrill said he was asked to sign statements admitting the actions but refused because, he said, they weren't true. He said he was fired for not signing the statements.
Courtney Caron confirmed that Sherrill would not have been fired if he had signed the statements.
Sherrill had no prior experience with utilities, but Caron said that was not a factor in his dismissal.
The board members opposing his dismissal, Vivien Spicer-Johnson and Cathy Nelson-Hood, contend that the board majority won election because of union support and was acting on its behalf.
Sherrill said he had many problems trying to get employees to follow his directions.
He said he will ask for his severance as guaranteed in his contract: $120,000, which represents 18 months of pay and benefits.
The board is discussing replacing Sherrill with Dave Andres, who served as the district's general manager from 2002 to 2006. Andres left the district to become the general manager of a water district in Calaveras County, where he worked until last year.
Andres said he needs to agree to terms with the district and pass a background check. He said he would serve for six months. A retiree, Andres said he only wants to help the district with some of its most pressing problems, including finding a permanent general manager.
The district has an assortment of financial problems. Sherrill said he worked 16-hour days, and repeatedly found hidden bills that had gone unpaid for years.
"The financial records are a disaster," he said. "This district is in total disarray."
Struggling to get an accurate picture of the budget, the district has tried to hire an auditor, Sherrill said. But the auditor has declined to proceed until receiving partial payment, and the district can barely afford to make payroll and pay other bills, he said.
Sherrill and board members say the district is under investigation by the District Attorney's Office, which has taken boxes of documents from the district.
A grand jury report this year found that management turnover and disputes among board members were at the heart of the district's problems. "It is unclear who � if anyone � is running the district," the grand jury said.
The Sacramento Local Agency Formation Commission is also interested in reorganizing the water district.
"The board faces some tough choices," Andres said. "I'm prepared to work with the board."

description.hltext_display: 究竟谁推高了国际煤价？
description.content: 近日，有国外媒体将煤炭价� �的上涨归� 于中国等新兴市场需求大增。毫� 疑问，近年来中国等新兴经济体的快速发展在带动能源需求不断增� 的同时，能源进口量也呈增长态势，这对国际煤价高位运行起到一定支撑作用。但是，国外部分媒体以及一些相关人士动辄将煤价上涨原� 归咎于这些新兴经济体的做法显然带有更多主观色彩。笔者认为，充其量只能说中国等新兴市场需求对国际煤价起到了一定的支撑作用，而不能将国际煤价上涨的主要原� 归咎于中国等新兴市场。 如同2008年国际煤价上涨一� �，此轮国际煤价上涨也是全球性大宗商品普遍上涨的表现之一。但是，当前全球大宗商品价� �上涨与2007、2008年那轮也有不同之处，当时世界经济正处于快速发展阶段，实体经济需求旺盛，而当前世界经济可以说是刚刚摆脱一场百年一遇的全球金融危机，仍处于缓慢复苏之中，部分实体经济需求尚未完全恢复至金融危机之前水平。� 此，导致此轮包括煤炭在内的国际市场大宗商品价� �上涨的主要是货币� � 以及其他� � 。 首先，美元贬值是国际市场包括煤炭在内的大宗商品价� �上涨的重要推动� � 之一。虽然今年上半年美元曾一度连续升值，但是，下半年美元快速走低，2008年年底以来，美元整体上呈震荡下行态势。今年11月5日，美元指数曾回落至76.58点，与2008年11月最低的85.8点相比，下降了10.75%。也就是说，与2008年11月美元币值相比，美元贬值使当前国际市场以美元计价的大宗商品价� �上涨了10%左右。当然，国际煤价也不例外，美元贬值在一定程度上抬高了欧洲市场煤炭价� �。 其次，为抵御全球金融危机，美国、日本以及欧元区均采取了低利率、零利率甚至是量化宽松的货币政策，市场上流动性十分充裕。今年7月份之后，考虑到美国经济表现不佳，市场预期美联储将在适当情况下再次启动量化宽松货币政策。正是从这时开始，全球大宗商品价� �再度进入上行通道。10月，市场关于美国重启量化宽松的预期进一步增强，与此同时，国际市场大宗商品价� �也开始快速上扬。11月3日，美联储终于宣布将在2011年二季度前购进6000亿美元国债，持续很长时间的市场预期终于变为现实，国际市场大宗商品价� �高歌猛进。11月10日，WTI原油期货价� �达到87.18美元/桶，创2008年10月9日以来新高，煤炭价� �也快速上扬。� 此，可以说正是以美国为首的发达国家重启量化宽松货币政策� 成国际市场流动性泛滥，从而在� �本上推动了国际市场大宗商品价� �不断上涨。 最后，国际金融资本借机炒作也是推高包括煤炭在内的国际市场大宗商品价� �的重要原� 。在金融对经济的影响日益� 强、金融全球化程度不断� 深以及国际市场流动性泛滥的情况下，再� 上投资银行等金融机构鼓吹宣� ，市场稍有任何利好，都可能会被过分夸大，国际市场大宗商品价� �被一步步推高。仔细观察不难发现，� 论是2007、2008年，还是当前国际市场大宗商品价� �上涨，国际知名投行鼓吹之声处处可闻。 总而言之，中国等新兴经济快速发展带动的旺盛需求在一定程度上支撑了煤价，支撑了其他大宗商品价� �，但是导致价� �上涨的� �本原� 不在于此，而是美欧量化宽松的货币政策，是美元长期的贬值趋势，是国际金融资本的肆意炒作。 （作者李廷为中商流通生产力促进中心煤炭分析师）

description.hltext_display: Ridd off target at darts world champs
description.content:
Relevant offers Other sports New Zealand's presence in the world darts championship ended predictably early in London overnight (NZT) when rank outsider Preston Ridd was eliminated in the first round by 20th-ranked Dutchman Vincent van der Voort.
Ridd, a six-time national champion from Christchurch, was ousted three sets to nil and was staring at a complete drubbing before he claimed his only leg of a one-sided contest on day six of the tournament at Alexandra Palace.
The 59-year-old, who progressed to the main draw after crushing Northern Ireland's Michael Mansell 4-0 in a best of seven set qualifier earlier in the programme, gained some consolation when he won the opening leg of the third and final set after van der Voort squandered a massive advantage by missing 23 attempts at doubles - including a sequence that could have maintained his 100 per cent record.
The Dutchman recovered to win the next three legs to close out the set and the tie.
Ridd, rated a 750 to one chance of winning the title before the 72-strong field was whittled down from last Thursday, had only an eight per cent success rate when attempting to hit doubles; van der Voort, who made the last 16 in 2009, only recorded 27 per cent to underscore a low quality clash.
However, van der Voort nailed the maximum three-dart score of 180 four times to Ridd's none, emphasising his total dominance.
The title, currently held by 15-time champion Phil Taylor of England, end on January 3. Next Other sports story: Sport Homepage

event_or_fact.property: his only leg of a one-sided contest on day six of the tournament at Alexandra Palace

description.hltext_display: William Kurtz
Hawke's Bay score late to draw with Phoenix A
description.content:
Relevant offers Football Wellington Phoenix A's quest for an elusive $2000 winner's cheque continues after a late goal to hattrick hero Chris McIvor salvaged Hawke's Bay United a 3-3 draw in their challenge series match at Park Island, Napier, tonight.
Hawke's Bay led 2-0 at halftime after McIvor had bagged a first half double, but the Phoenix looked set to claim all the spoils after defender James Musa scored an unlikely brace and young striker Sean Lovemore scored the go-ahead goal in the 77th minute.
They had to split the pot, however, after McIvor headed home at the neat post in the 90th minute to score his third goal.
The Phoenix A team, a mixed of fringe A-League players and young New Zealand talent, have lost three and drawn two of their five matches against national league franchises.
Phoenix midfielder Nick Ward, who had been sidelined with a knee injury since the 2-1 A-League win against Adelaide at Christchurch on December 5, played the first half before being substituted, while All Whites defender Tony Lochhead's return from groin surgery stepped up a gear with a 77-minute stint tonight.
Phoenix coach Ricki Herbert is hopeful both players will be back in the first-team by the January 5 home match against Melbourne Victory.
Hawke's Bay United 3 (Chris McIvor 3) Wellington Phoenix A 3 (James Musa 2, Sean Lovemore). Halftime: 2-0.

description.hltext_display: Elegant Prime Rib Makes Holiday Dinners a Celebration
description.content:
Turkey may have begun the holiday eating season and a New Years ham may be its finale but for Christmas dinner it’s all about the beef. And the cut of choice is Prime Rib.
Prime Rib is an indulgent and impressive cut which during the holidays is more affordable than most other premium beef cuts such as tenderloin when it becomes a featured item at the local meat counter.
Available with or without the rib attached Prime Rib (aka Standing Rib) is easy to prepare. This classic cut of beef is extremely tender, favorable and juicy; making it a perfect pick for the hurried home cook. A personal choice is the bone-in, Prime Rib because an impressive show stopper. However the boneless version is just as flavorable and is easier carve. Better yet, a boneless Prime Rib has the ability to be cut into steaks – better know as the Rib-eye.
The best way to cook Prime Rib is uncovered using dry heat methods, which results in producing the flavorful, deep brown crusty exterior. After roasting allow the roast to rest before carving to ensure that the juices in the center have time to redistribute for maximum flavor and tenderness. This method will provide excellent results whether your Prime Rib is bone-in or boneless.
When purchasing a Prime Rib/Standing Rib Roast use this rule of thumb to determine how much to purchase. If buying a boneless Prime Rib roast plan on a half pound of uncooked weight per person. For bone-in Prime Rib roast make that a pound per person. Another way to figure servings on the bone- in Standing Rib (another names for Prime Rib) is to allow two servings per rib.
Omaha Steaks has a holiday gift food prime rib lovers, free recipes and cooking tips booklet, "The Great Gathering Guide and Cookbook” It’s available free online at www.OmahaSteaks.com.
Peppered Prime Beef
1 prime rib roast, with 2 to 4 ribs
1 can (14 to 14-1/2 ounces) ready-to-serve beef broth
2 teaspoons chopped fresh thyme
Rub:
2 tablespoons pepper seasoning blend
2 tablespoons minced garlic
Heat oven to 350°F. Combine rub ingredients in small bowl; reserve 2 tablespoons for
au jus. Press remaining rub evenly onto all surfaces of beef roast and place roast, fat side up, in shallow roasting pan. Insert ovenproof meat thermometer so tip is centered in thickest part of beef, not resting in fat or touching bone. Do not add water or cover. Roast for 2-1/4 to 2-1/2 hours for medium rare; 2-3/4 to 3 hours for medium doneness. Remove roast when meat thermometer registers 135°F for medium rare; 150°F for medium. Transfer roast to carving board; tent loosely with aluminum foil. Let stand 15 to 20 minutes. (Temperature will continue to rise about 10°F to reach 145°F for medium rare; 160°F for medium.)
To make au jus combine broth and reserved rub in small saucepan; bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer 5 minutes. Stir in thyme; continue simmering 2 minutes. Carve roast into slices. Season to taste with salt, as desired. Serve with au jus or a horseradish sauce.
Creamy Chive Horseradish Sauce
1 cup sour cream
1/3 cup horseradish
2 teaspoons fresh chopped chives (minced green onions can be substituted)
Kosher salt and fresh ground pepper to taste.
Mkx all the above together and chill until ready to serve.
Roasted Baby Red Potatoes
2 pounds baby red potatoes
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 tablespoon garlic, chopped
1 teaspoon rosemary, chopped
1 teaspoon oregano, chopped
1/2cup Romano cheese, grated
2 teaspoons kosher salt
1/2 teaspoon black pepper, ground
Preheat oven to 250. Wash and quarter potatoes. Add potatoes to a bowl and mix with remaining ingredients. Place potatoes on a foil lined sheet pan. .Bake for 45 minutes. Stir potatoes well, being sure to flip them all over. Increase oven temperature to 400 and bake potatoes an additional 30 minutes or until brown.
Holiday Green Beans
1 pound green beans, trimmed
1 lemon, cut in half
1 cup croutons, coarsely ground
6 slices bacon, cooked and coarsely chopped
2 tablespoons butter, thinly sliced
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt
Preheat oven to 350. Blanch green beans in boiling water or steamer for 6 to 8 minutes until al dente. Cool in an ice bath and drain well. Spread cooled green beans in a 9 x 13-inch casserole dish. Squeeze lemon juice evenly over green beans. Sprinkle top of green beans with ground croutons and bacon bits. Place butter slices evenly throughout the dish. Sprinkle salt over the top. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes. Serves 4 to 6

description.hltext_display: Clubmeister: Schramm & Neuendorfer
Las bolas de la ilusión
description.content:
El Gordo de Navidad ha caído en la Comunitat en 31 ocasiones hasta el pasado año.
No se han recibido valoraciones.
DIARIO CRÍTICO COMUNITAT VALENCIANA - Miércoles 22 de diciembre de 2010 a las 09:08 h.
El Gordo de Navidad, para el que este año se han consignado en la Comunitat Valenciana 399.038.480 euros, ha caído 31 veces en esta autonomía hasta el pasado año, según datos de Loterías y Apuestas del Estado. En concreto, en la provincia de Valencia, este premio ha caído en 17 ocasiones; en la de Alicante, en 12, y en la de Castellón, en dos.
Entre las poblaciones de la provincia de Valencia agraciadas con el primer premio del sorteo extraordinario de la Lotería de Navidad, que se celebra hoy, 22 de diciembre, en Madrid, como es tradicional, está la capital, donde ha caído en once ocasiones, la última en 2006, con el número 20.297. Así, El Gordo llegó a esta ciudad en 1847, 1904, 1930, 1941, 1950, 1953, 1959, 1985, 1996, 2003 y 2006.
Asimismo, en esta provincia el primer premio de la lotería de Navidad ha caído en Alzira dos veces, en 1933 y 1968; en Manises, también en dos ocasiones, en concreto, en 1971 y 1986; en Sueca, en 1966; Paiporta, en 1989, y Massamagrell, en 2003.
En la provincia de Alicante, por otro lado, El Gordo ha llegado doce veces, la última, en 2008 a Torrevieja. En la capital alicantina el primer premio del sorteo extraordinario de Navidad ha caído en seis ocasiones, en 1900, 1906, 1937, 1987, 2006 y 2007, según los datos de Loterías y Apuestas.
Los otros puntos de la provincia de Alicante que se han visto agraciados con este premio han sido Almoradí, en 1980; El Campello, en 1993; Novelda, en 1998; Elche, en 1999; Elda, en 2002; Benidorm, en 2006, y Onil, también en ese año.
Por lo que se refiere a la provincia de Castellón, El Gordo de Navidad ha llegado en dos ocasiones, en 1934, a Castellón ciudad, y en 1964, a la localidad de Vinaròs, según los mismos datos.
El sorteo extraordinario de lotería de Navidad, que se celebra cada 22 de diciembre en Madrid, está considerado como "el más importante y popular de todos los sorteos" de la lotería española, según Loterías y Apuestas del Estado.
Este sorteo tiene sus orígenes en el celebrado el 18 de diciembre de 1812, "más por el entusiasmo, sentir popular y proximidad" a las Navidades "que por la denominación en sí mismo". La designación de 'Sorteo de Navidad' apareció por primera vez en 1892.
El de Navidad se celebra por el sistema tradicional de sorteo, con un bombo para números y otro para premios, y tiene una duración aproximada de tres horas y media. Este año, consta de 195 series, cada una de las cuales tiene 85.000 billetes, con un precio cada uno de 200 euros, dividido en décimos de 20 euros. El precio de un número completo es de 39.000 euros.
El total de la emisión de este año es de 3.315.000.000 euros. El montante que se destina a premios (el 70 por ciento de la emisión, dado que el 30 por ciento restante es para gastos de gestión, administración y Tesoro Público) alcanza los 2.320.500.000 euros. Cada serie distribuye en premios 11.900.000 euros. En conjunto se reparten 26.001.300 premios. En el bombo entran los 85.000 números de los billetes del sorteo.

description.hltext_display: 山西煤焦领域反腐败打黑 906名政府官员落马
description.author: www.qq.com
description.content:
中新社太原12月22日电 (记者 张恩)记者22日在山西煤焦领域反腐败专项斗争查处案件情况新闻发布会上了解，山西省加大煤焦领域发腐败专项行动，提高办案的整体效能，今年1至11月，906名政府公职人员相继“落马”，依法受到严厉惩处。
山西省检察厅副厅长邢顺喜介绍，截止今年11月，山西各级煤焦领域发腐败专项斗争领导组办公室共立查案件2185件，处分2353人。今年1至11月，山西全省共受理民众信访举报759件，立案591件，初核煤焦领域违纪线索718件，立案查处591件，处分违纪干部906人，涉及厅级干部7人，县处级干部109人，乡科级干部262人。
记者在此间获悉，今年山西已查处及正查处的典型案件令人触目惊心。如大同市原副市长王雁峰在煤矿置换过程中收受巨额贿赂案、大同市公安局原局长申公元在煤矿置换过程中收受巨额贿赂案、晋城市煤炭局总工程师、党组成员刘俊文收受有关煤矿负责人贿赂108万元人民币，巨额财产441万元来源不明案等。
有关人士指出，山西煤焦领域案件查办行动将继续进行。今后要健全办案的激励和制约机制，重点查处政府官员插手煤焦业务入股、牟取暴利、利用审批监管、资金划拨、票据管理、权钱交易，利用资源整合倒卖国有资源、利用批煤发煤、基本建设、资产评估、大宗物资采购，从事商业贿赂以及私挖滥采背后黑“保护伞”等违纪违法案件。
这位负责人强调，山西在煤焦领域专项行动中实行严格问责制，对瞒案不报、压案不批、有案不查者，加大责任查究。(完)

description.hltext_display: Seven Kiwis make cut at Melbourne q-school
description.content:
Relevant offers Golf Seven New Zealand golfers have received PGA Tour of Australasia status for 2011 by making the cut after three rounds of the final qualifying tournament at Peninsula Golf Club, Melbourne.
The challenge now is to force their way into the top 10 after tomorrow's final round with OneAsia tour membership up for grabs.
Brad Shilton is the best placed to achieve that; he shares 13th at one-over par after carding a one-under 71 on the North Course today.
Nick Gillespie and David Klein are two shots back in 21st after rounds of 72 and 70, respectively, while Mathew Holton is 29th at five-over and Hamish Roberston lies 36th at seven-over after blowing out with a 77 today.
The other New Zealanders to make the cut were Josh Carmichael (eight-over) and Peter Spearman-Burn (12-over).
Aaron Leech, Jonny Dittmer, Andrew Green, Thomas Spearman-Burn and Gary-John Hill all missed the cut mark as the top 72 players progressed to the final round.
Australian Neven Basic leades the tournament with a seven-under total of 209.

description.hltext_display: Mark Wahlberg - Promoter Offers Charity Millions If Smith & Wahlberg Fight
description.content:
A top boxing promoter has offered to hand over $2 million (£1.3 million) to charity if MARK WAHLBERG and WILL SMITH agree to step into the ring for a celebrity boxing bout.
Both stars have played champions on the big screen and now Hollywood Boxing Federation boss Damon Feldman is keen to see what the two actors have learned from their research for films Ali and The Fighter.
Feldman tells U.S. news show Access Hollywood, "It would be a good show, a good, fast, easy way to make money."

event_or_fact.property: "It would be a good show, a good, fast, easy way to make money.

description.hltext_display: Pike River: 'Four months to re-enter'
description.content:
Pike River Coal's receivers say it could be up to four months to re-enter the mine in which 29 workers died in an explosion last month.
Receivers PricewaterhouseCoopers today presented a draft plan for re-entry to the ill-fated mine at a meeting with police today.
The draft plan was prepared by a panel of technical experts including company staff, mines rescue personnel from New Zealand and Australia and other subject expertise.
The plan contains two phases. Firstly, it suggests some additional work to stabilise the mine, including sealing the cracks in the ground to help reduce the flow of gases out of the mine.
Secondly, it sets out a plan to enter the mine to recover the remains of the 29 workers. This is dependent on the mine environment.
As he left the meeting a representative for the receivers said it could be up to four months before re-entry to the mine was possible.
The plan had been given to Police Commissioner Howard Broad and would be peer reviewed.
Tonight Mr Broad said the plan required detailed consideration by police force and its advisers.
"This will take several weeks."
Police would retain control of the work to stabilise the mine in the meantime. Next National story: National Homepage

event_or_fact.property: the plan required detailed consideration by police force and its advisers

description.hltext_display: Natural Dairy's Crafar bid rejected
description.content:
Relevant offers Farming The Crafar farm estate will not be sold to Natural Dairy, the government has ruled.
Land information minister Maurice Williamson and Kate Wilkinson, who is acting for the finance minister Bill English, said today they have declined consent to Hong-Kong listed Natural Dairy (NZ) Holdings to acquire 16 of the farms.
The decision covers the applications by Natural Dairy to acquire UBNZ Assets Holdings Limited and a retrospective application to acquire four Crafar farms which UBNZ purchased in February 2010.
"We concur with the Overseas Investment Office's recommendation that consent should be declined," they said in a joint statement.
"We will not be commenting further on our decision."
Businesswoman May Wang was fronting the bid for a group of Chinese investors who wanted to buy the dairy farms, worth around $1.5 billion.
But she was made bankrupt and her affairs put in the hands of the Official Assignee after her hotel and property business collapsed, owing $22 million.
This week it was announced Wang would no longer front the bid.
The Crafar farms, totalling 8000ha in the southern and central North Island, were put into receivership in October 2009 by their financiers, owed $200 million.
For the deal to go ahead, it needed to get approval from the Overseas Investment Office, as it was a foreign investment of more than $100 million.
However, in October the SFO announced it was launching an investigation into Natural Dairy over the proposed sale and purchase agreements.
UBNZ bought four Crafar farms earlier this year for about $47.5 million.
The Crafar deal sparked a heated debate over foreigners buying up New Zealand land.
A review into overseas investment prompted Finance Minister Bill English to issue new guidelines.
The guidelines kick in next year and so did not apply to Natural Dairy's application.
Ministers can now consider if New Zealand's economic interests were adequately safeguarded and promoted in such a deal. Next Farming story:

event_or_fact.property: they have declined consent to Hong-Kong listed Natural Dairy (NZ) Holdings to acquire 16 of the farms

description.hltext_display: Strahlende Weltmeister
Father denies charges
description.content:
Relevant offers Crime A man charged in connection with horrific acts of abuse on his nine-year-old daughter wanted to drive her mad so he could collect welfare, a court was told today.
The 32-year-old man and his ex-partner, 30, were today denied bail when they appeared in Waitakere District Court, Judge Lisa Tremewan stating that the police had a strong enough case against them.
The charges - there are 36 in total - make for grim reading.
They include assault on the girl with a machete, hammer, vacuum cleaner pipe and broomstick; kicking her in the vaginal area while wearing work boots; tearing her toenail off; pouring salt on her bleeding toe; writing abusive comments on her body; immersing her in a hot bath in a manner likely to cause unnecessary suffering; making her stand for prolonged periods in a manner likely to cause unnecessary suffering; denying her medical treatment and withholding food. The woman faces 33 charges and the man three.
The woman is also charged with assaulting her seven-year-old son by strangling him and dragging around by his neck, and assaulting him with an unknown object.
It was also revealed today that another of the girl's relatives has been charged with sexually abusing her while she was in Child, Youth and Family care.
The accused man's lawyer, Brenda Donald, told the court today witnesses had claimed to police that he had told them he wanted to drive his daughter mad so she could be put into a child mental health facility and he could collect welfare.
This made no sense, she said, and the man "strongly" denied this and all other charges against him.
The man had previously been arrested for assaulting his co-accused and had breached a condition of his bail by going to the family's home.
The man claimed that his ex-partner was the only offender and he did not know of the extent of the abuse on his daughter.
Police had initially not opposed bail but changed their position as the case unfolded.
The judge said her concerns were heightened by the accused woman's refusal to be examined by the forensic nurse yesterday.
"There is, of course, a presumption of innocence.
"However, the court is entitled to consider the strength of the police case. At first blush it appears to me that the police case is a strong one."
Police had indicated that certain admissions had been made and they had medical evidence and photographs, formal written statements, and had recovered weapons that were involved, Judge Tremewan said.
Detective Sergeant Megan Goldie said earlier today that the nine-year-old was receiving psychological and other specialist treatment and was likely to need regular counselling for the rest of her life. The other children in the family would also need counselling.
"Such is the severity of the injuries endured by the nine-year-old victim that the police investigators and others who have been associated with the inquiry have all been affected by what they have encountered," she said.
Social Development Minister Paula Bennett has ordered an investigation into Child Youth and Family and other agencies' interactions with the family and the child.
The accused will reappear in court on January 14 for a plea inquiry hearing.
Next Crime story: National Homepage

description.hltext_display: Jenny Mccarthy - Mccarthy Creates Non-toxic Baby Bedding
description.content:
Model-turned-actress JENNY MCCARTHY is helping to put new mums at ease - by launching her own range of eco-friendly crib bedding.
The star's Too Good line features all-cotton sheets, blankets, rugs and hampers and all materials used are non-toxic.
MCCarthy admits she was inspired to create the collection because she was well aware of the fears she faced as she brought up her son Evan, eight.
She tells Us Weekly, "I was psychotic about keeping my house clean, so I wanted items without harsh chemicals."

description.hltext_display: Burglars don't take a holiday on Christmas in Sacramento
description.author: preese@sacbee.com (Phillip Reese
description.content:
Last Christmas, a grinch visited the Romaso family.
They returned from church and fellowship with relatives on Christmas Day and found that a burglar had broken into their home near Carmichael.
"My laptop and printer were gone; my sister's Christmas presents were taken," said Olga Romaso, a student at Sacramento State. "My mother is a Ukrainian school teacher and her school bag was taken with all her lesson plans."
Most types of crime fall sharply on Christmas Day, largely because few cars are on the road and few businesses are open. Burglaries like the one experienced by the Romasos are an exception.
On the last three Christmases, county residents reported 143 burglaries, or about 50 each year. That's almost as many burglaries each Christmas as would occur on a typical day, city police and county sheriff's crime data show.
"Christmas Day is definitely a target," said Sacramento County Sheriff's Department Sgt. Tim Curran. "People know that homes are full of gifts."
Unlike the Dr. Seuss story, these grinches typically don't have a change of heart. Nor do they usually get arrested. The clearance rate for burglaries in the county is about 10 percent, a bit lower than the statewide average.
All that said, don't panic and padlock your presents. Those 143 burglaries translate to about one theft for every 3,500 county households.
Olga Romaso and her family were among the unlucky last Christmas. When they returned home that day, they noticed burning lights and an unlocked front door.
Olga Romaso went to her room. "My drawers were left ajar, my bed was moved and everything was scattered and messy," she said.
Besides the laptop, printer and gifts, the thief also took student book deposit money Romaso's mom kept for her pupils. Nothing was ever recovered. A sympathetic relative helped replace a laptop and printer.
"My mom had to use her own money to pay back the children," Olga Romaso said, referring to the missing book deposit money.
"My sister is only a year younger than me. She hadn't opened her presents yet so she doesn't know what was missing. It would have been stuff like clothes, makeup."
Unlike the Romasos, Arden resident Debbie Tichenor got to confront the burglar who stole from her on Christmas Day two years ago � and it left her shaken.
While at a friend's house on Christmas Day two years ago, Tichenor's children called her to say that sheriff's deputies had caught a man trying to break into her car.
The man had taken much of her change � and her work ID card, possibly as a way to steal her identity. She went to meet deputies at her car, which was parked in Arden.
Deputies spread all they had recovered from the suspected burglar on the hood and asked Tichenor to identify her belongings.
"'The change, possibly mine,'" she recalled telling the officers. "'The crack pipe, not mine.'"
Tichenor said she felt sorry for the suspect who was in custody, despite his actions.
"When they said he was going to jail, he started pleading and begging," she said. "What a sad way to spend Christmas."
The areas hit hardest by Christmas burglaries last year were Carmichael, with seven, and North Natomas, with five.
The Tichenors and Romasos have moved on from their tough Christmases. They are thankful that no one was hurt during the burglaries.
"This incident comes to mind once in a while, but I don't let it worry me because I know that there will be more Christmases," Romaso said. "Life goes on, and the hardships and difficult situations we endure, build us."
Online Extra: A Christmas visitor, not St. Nick
Three years ago on Christmas morning, burglars broke into the Rosemont home of Shannon Gasper-Bone and her family. Here's what she had to say about the incident via an interview conducted over Facebook ...
Bee: What happened during the incident? What was stolen and how did you know you had fallen victim to burglary?
Gasper-Bone: It was Christmas morning at 2:30 am and my husband and I were just going to bed. We had 2 huge dogs but brought them in the bedroom with us and shut the door. When we woke up at 8 a.m. I noticed that my purse was gone off the dining room table. Thinking I misplaced it, I searched everywhere. Then my husband remembered that he left his wallet on table next to my purse. That is when we figured out that it was stolen.
Our dining room table is visible from back yard window. We had an ex-large dog door and we left the slider open. We are not sure if they came through the dog door or figured out that the door was unlocked. They must have been watching us threw the back window due to our late bedtime. They had to have known.
Normally we do not worry because of the dogs but they were getting into their stockings so we locked them up. They were bugging to go outside but I thought they were messing around (little did I know). We also found out in the morning that they had taken a bike from the side of our house. We contacted the sheriff right away.
Bee: Were you surprised that someone would steal from you on Christmas? Did it ruin the day for you?
Gasper-Bone: It did not surprise me. That is probably a big theft day since people want to give and get more than they can afford.
It put a slight damper on our day because I was supposed to work that morning and was several hours late waiting for sheriff's (deputies) and because I was emotionally upset to think about someone else being in our house while we slept. We have a son that was sleeping down the hallway across from us.
On the other hand we feel very lucky that nobody was hurt and that our Christmas presents were not touched. If they would have gone in the next living room they would have had access to our laptop and all the Christmas presents (which included a Wii game system). They wanted money and were in and out quick. The day could have been a lot worse.
Bee: Did you ever recover what was stolen? Is the incident still on your mind this Christmas, or have you stopped thinking about it?
Gasper-Bone: None of the items were recovered.
It is very disappointing that this happens so often and fingerprinting is so expensive that it is not done. I do still think about that day. Since then we have removed the dog door, installed an alarm on the house, and are very careful about locking all the doors and keeping the drapes and blinds shut.
We also now have three large dogs and we never lock them up. They are up and barking at the smallest noises. We have not had a problem since that night and are very thankful.

My laptop and printer were gone; my sister's Christmas presents were taken; My mother is a Ukrainian school teacher and her school bag was taken with all her lesson plans.

description.hltext_display: Lady Gaga - Gaga Fan Questioned By Cops Over 'backstage Break-in'
description.content:
LADY GAGA was left distressed after a fan used fake backstage passes to sneak through strict security in a bid to meet the superstar at London's 02 Arena last week (ends19Dec10), according to U.K. reports.
The Poker Face hitmaker put on two sold-out shows at the huge venue in the U.K. capital, but was left shocked before Thursday's (16Dec10) concert when she was informed a devotee had made her way backstage.
The woman had forged passes which helped her evade the star's security team - and she was only caught out by Gaga's management as she made her way to the singer's dressing room, according to Britain's Daily Mirror.
Police were called and the woman was reportedly released after questioning.
A source tells the newspaper, "This was a serious breach of security and the woman was heading in the direction of the stage and, more worryingly, Gaga's dressing room.
"This woman had gone to great lengths to produce all the fake ­documentation so she could move at ease in the holding area backstage.
"Gaga was understandably shaken by the incident but was a consummate professional and continued as per normal, putting on a dazzling show."

description.hltext_display: Bernie Reynolds
Freiwilliger Abstieg ein Thema
Diplomat urges Zambians to vote
description.content:
INDIAN High Commissioner to Zambia Ashok Kumar has urged the people of Zambia to exercise their democratic rights by taking part in the 2011 tripartite elections.
Mr Kumar said it was everyone’s right to take part in national elections to choose leaders of their choice.
Speaking during a fundraising dinner organised by the Eastern Province Chamber of Commerce and Industry (EPCCI) at Protea Hotel in Chipata on Friday evening, Mr Kumar said people in a democratic country like Zambia should learn to exercise their rights in voting for political parties and leaders of their choice.
And Mr Kumar said Zambia has been a major beneficiary of Indian technical and economic cooperation (ITEC) programmes.
He said about 2,300 Zambians had received training under ITEC in India in capacity building in different areas.
He said ITEC training slots to African countries were increased from 1,100 to 1,600 a year during the India Africa forum summit.
He also told the gathering that included EPCCI president, Timothy Nyirenda and other business executives that the historic visit of the vice-president of India in January this year had given a new fillip to the bilateral relations with Zambia.
He said the Indian government has a new line of credit of US$75million for development projects in Zambia and a grant of $5 million for projects in social sectors was announced by Indian vice-president.
Mr Kumar said Vedanta Resource, the parent company of Sterlite Industries in India, had invested $1.5 billion in Konkola Copper Mine (KCM) with the investments expected to reach $3 billion in the next three years.
He said RJ Corporation of India has pledged to invest US$ 30million on Pepsi Manufacturing Plant.
Speaking at the same function, Works and Supply Deputy Minister, Lameck Mangani said the Government was happy with the assistance from the government of India.
Mr Mangani said the Government was also ensuring that the road network was worked on and cited the Great East Road from Luangwa Bridge to Mwami border as a good example of what the Government was doing.

description.hltext_display: Vijender Singh the star of a 'golden year'
description.content:
NEW DELHI: It started with an unprecedented gold rush and ended pretty much the same way as Indian boxers scaled new heights and broke new barriers with Olympic hero Vijender Singh once again leading the charge by clinching two gold medals and a bronze in a super successful 2010.
The season began with three gold medals in the South Asian Games in Dhaka in February with Chhote Lal Yadav (57kg), Asian champion Suranjoy Singh (51kg) and Amandeep Singh (48kg) finishing on top.
Just a month later, the boxers landed half a dozen gold medals with a cracker of a performance in front of adoring home fans in the Commonwealth Championships.
Trading punches in front of crowds that generally don't turn up for non-cricket sporting events in India, the sextet of Vijender (75kg), South Asian Games gold medallist Amandeep (49kg), Suranjoy (52kg), Asian silver medallist Jai Bhagwan (60kg), Olympian Dinesh Kumar (81kg) and Paramjeet Samota (+91kg) fetched gold to further enhance the sport's rising profile in the country.
This was Vijender's first gold medal in two years, adding to the aura of the strapping six-footer, who remained the world number one from beginning to the end of 2010 -- his supremacy at the top unchallenged.
The championship, in fact, was just a prelude to a fantastic performance in the Commonwealth Games that were to follow six months later, again in the capital.
In the build-up to the Games, Vijender and Co took went for a month-long trip to Cuba to get battle-hardened in the 'spiritual home of boxing' and the improvement was there to be seen when they finally took the ring in the main-event.
Even as the Commonwealth Games Federation complained of lack of crowds at CWG venues, the dome-shaped Talkatora Stadium was witness to an atmosphere which can only be described as electric in every single session of the boxing competition.
Fans queued up as the likes of Vijender, Suranjoy and Akhil Kumar (56kg) began their gold quest in the biggest sporting event India was hosting since the 1982 Asian Games.
It turned out to be a bitter-sweet campaign in the end with Vijender settling for bronze after a controversial loss in the semifinals and defending champion Akhil signing off without a medal following a quarterfinal defeat.
But Suranjoy, Manoj Kumar (64kg) and Paramjit Samota (+91kg) ensured that Indian boxing pulled off its best-ever performance in the Games history by notching up gold medals.
Besides their golds, four bronze came through Amandeep (49kg), Dilbagh Singh (69kg), Vijender and Jai Bhagwan (60kg) making CWG a memorable event for Indian pugilists.
But Vijender's loss was a massive disappointment as he went down without conceding a single scoring punch when the referee penalised him twice for clinching and holding on to his rival in the semifinal.
However, the poster boy of Indian boxing took the setback on his chin and promised a gold in the Asian Games which took place just a month later. And he delivered the goods at his happy hunting ground, China where the event was held in the city of Guangzhou.
There was skepticism that the boxers, who got just a month to rest and recover after the CWG, would under-perform in the Asiad but all such fears vanished once the competition began as Indian pugilists fetched two yellow metals at the event for the first time after Dingko Singh's gold in 1998.
In the end, the Indian boxers managed a brilliant haul of two gold, three silver and four bronze medals without showing any sign of fatigue.
The only disappointment of the event was Suranjoy settling for bronze after entering the event gunning for an eighth straight international gold. But that apart, the Asiad was an affair to remember for Indian boxing.
The 25-year-old Vijender's was the most dramatic final as he squared off against two-time world champion and old nemesis Abbos Atoev of Uzbekistan with a dislocated thumb. Fighting practically with just one hand, he still managed to blank his rival 0-7 in a completely lop-sided encounter.
Vijender aside, the Games boxing competition threw up a second unexpected gold medallist for India in 18-year-old Vikas Krishan (60kg).
The lanky boxer from Haryana, who incidentally looks up to Vijender for inspiration, was the find of the year along with another teen sensation Shiva Thapa.
The two made India proud at the Youth World Championships in May where Vikas clinched a gold, while Shiva settled for silver after fighting his final bout with a stress fracture in his hand. The duo proved themselves again a couple of months later at the inaugural Youth Olympics in Singapore where Shiva got a silver while Vikas came back with a bronze.
The men and the boys had a consistently good run but in the women's arena it was only 'The Magnificent' M C Mary Kom who made an impression.
The Manipuri mother of two added an unprecedented fifth to her kitty but the rest of the women boxers flopped at the September event, fetching just a bronze to go with Mary Kom's gold.
But women's boxing, in general, got a massive boost when the included it in the 2012 London Games roster. It also made its debut at a multi-sporting event in the Asiad where the Indian women pugilists could only manage a couple of bronze medals through Mary Kom and Kavita Goyat.
The women's below-par show went unnoticed due to the brilliant performance of their male counterparts but they will have to get their act together quickly enough to ensure that their London 2012 debut is a memorable one.
All in all, Indian boxing continued its upward march that began with Vijender's historic bronze in the 2008 Beijing Olympics and the graph should head northwards even next year, which has the men's World Championships and Olympic qualifiers lined up.

description.hltext_display: Siesta Logistics Corporation Limited raises $10million PE investment from Ashmore Alchemy
description.content:
Siesta Logistics Corporation Limited, a leading Integrated Logistics Service Provider and a part of the diversified Siesta Group, today announced that it had raised $10 million in private equity from Ashmore Alchemy India, a joint venture between Alchemy Partners LLP and Ashmore Investments (UK).
Siesta Logistics began its operation in 2007 and is India’s only truly Integrated Logistics Service Provider with the capability to serve clients with a portfolio of customized solutions in the areas of transportation, freight forwarding, port and cargo services, Odd Dimension Cargo, Freight Forwarding, Customer House Agent, Warehouse Management Services, STPI and related services, 4PL and Consulting services. A professional, knowledge-rich enterprise, SLCL delivers customised solutions to create value and offer expertise-based consultancy services across the supply chain requirements of its customers.
Headquartered in Bangalore, Siesta Logistics Corporation Limited has a wide network that sprawls over almost all major cities of India and is supported by 20 global agents. The company has a strong network of transport branches and nearly 10 freight and customs outlets supported by 20 nominated agents effectively covering Asia, Australia, Hong Kong, Europe, South America and North America. In addition, the company is also a part of Global Logistics Network which has 375 members, offices in 382 cities and network in 132 countries across the globe. SLCL has successfully built a strong network of clients over the years. This includes Schneider Electric, Airbus, Fujitsu, ITC, UB Group, SBQ Steel, Philips, Parle Agro, Lakhani, Lilliput, Videocon, Shiv-Vani Oil, Thermax Industries, Everest Industries, Jubilant Organosys among others.
Commenting on the investment, Mr. Ashok Chattaraj, Chairman and Managing Director, Siesta Group said, “Siesta Logistics has charted an aggressive growth path since its inception and we are today one of the key players in India’s rapidly evolving logistics industry. The sustained growth in Indian industry, from manufacturing and retail to farming and technology, is creating an increasing need for seamless logistics solutions. Siesta Logistics seeks to invest in the development of India’s emergence as an economic powerhouse. The investment by Ashmore Alchemy will enable us to expand our reach and service portfolio and leverage the growth opportunity in the Indian logistics industry.”
Mr. Kiran Salunke, Managing Director, Siesta Logistics Corporation Limited said, “The minority stake investment by Ashmore Alchemy will be utilized to increase our global reach and service capabilities across the global logistics hub. Siesta Logistics is committed to building an enterprise that delivers comprehensive logistics solutions that meet our customer’s evolving needs. All our investments are aimed at scaling-up our operations and boosting our capabilities to deliver flawless and efficient solutions to our customers.”
The Siesta Group is a diversified business conglomerate with interests in Hospitality, Fine dining, Retail, Agri Business and Logistics. Founded in 2006 on the principles of delivering value propositions by leveraging innovative business models, the group’s hospitality business-Siesta Hospitality Services Limited (SHSL) is today recognised as a pioneer of ‘managed corporate residences’ in India with presence in 22 cities.. Currently, the group has over 900 employees across the country and operations spanning 7 countries including UK, Australia, China, Singapore, Hong Kong and Indonesia.
In addition to Siesta Logistics Corporation Limited, The Siesta Group’s diversified operations consists of – Imprints Retail and Infrastructure Limited (IRIL), a one-stop shop for the entire family’s footwear needs; Avanni Agri Ventures India Pvt. Ltd, an enterprise that is committed to catalysing the Indian agrarian ecosystem through technology, global know-how and next generation processes.\

description.hltext_display: 油菜籽产业之忧：种植面积萎缩
description.content:
―――长江流域油菜籽主产区冬季调研报告
12月12日至18日，华安期货联合美尔雅(600107,股吧)期货、大有期货、瑞奇期货组织了2010年长江流域油菜籽主产区考察活动。此次考察深入安徽、湖北、湖南、江西四省的菜籽主产区域，走访调查了农户、种子销售商、油脂加工企业和农委、粮食局等，对今年的播种情况、企业的生产经营、政府在油菜籽生产方面的政策措施进行了实地了解。
本次油菜籽考察涉及湖北、安徽、湖南、江西四省，这一带也是长江流域油菜籽主产区，产量占全国总产量的40%以上。考察团12月12日从安徽合肥出发，途径六安、金寨、湖北省荆门、荆州、湖南常德澧县、江西樟树、九江彭泽县，然后到达安徽池州，18日到达巢湖含山县。7天时间在主产区行进3000多公里，走访了多位当地农户、10家油脂加工企业和农委、粮食局、2家菜籽油交割库及4家中央储备油库。
油菜播种面积较往年有所下降
从安徽出发到湖北、湖南的路程中，考察团明显发现今年油菜播种面积较往年有所下降。道路两旁往年有较多油菜种植的土地，今年不少处于闲置状态，等待明年种稻谷和棉花，也有部分田地现在改种了小麦。在安徽到湖北的行程中，考察团看见较多的是稻子收割后闲置未翻耕的土地，以及在棉田里套种的刚出苗的小麦。安徽境内六安一带，只能看见零星的油菜田。进入湖北境内，尤其是快到荆门主产区，油菜田开始增多，但大多是撒播种植的油菜，移栽的区域很少。尽管移栽种植能提高油菜籽产量，但移栽费时费力，随着劳动力成本的增加，农民更多转向城市务工，精耕细作的传统有所改变。同时小麦的种植比例也不少，由于小麦适用于机械化收割，加上国家的保护收购价较高，种植收益可观，因此油菜在与小麦争地中明显处于劣势。油菜种植面积萎缩是考察团在安徽、湖北、湖南三省最直观的感受。
不过在考察团进入江西省，尤其是九江彭泽县一带时，上述状况有所改观，大片的油菜田映入眼帘，这也是此次考察中唯一发现油菜面积有所增加的地区。分析其中原因，一方面是由于当地土地偏湿，不适宜种小麦，没有了与油菜争地的粮食作物，另一方面也与当地政府、农委重视油菜生产，加强油菜种植管理有关。
在走访农户的过程中，湖北的农民预计，今年当地油菜种植面积可能减少30%以上，其中一部分改种麦子，另有很大一部分收割完水稻的空地，也未进行翻土，准备明年留种棉花。预计明年棉花的种植面积将有较大幅度上升。种植面积减少的情况也从种子销售商那里得到了印证，荆门旧口镇一位姓何的种子销售商告诉考察团，今年小麦和油菜籽的种子已经销售完毕，从销售情况看，油菜籽种子销量较往年减少50%，而小麦种子销量增加了50%。主要原因是油菜种植成本高，加上前期播种期湖北连续阴雨天气，菜籽难以播种。此外，目前调整农作物种植结构，一部分土地改种蔬菜等作物，挤占了原来的油菜种植面积。在走访的多家油脂加工企业中，相关人员预计今年当地的油菜播种面积减少幅度均在20%左右。唯有江西九江地区农户对油菜的种植热情较高，主要由于政府对油菜种植的扶植力度较大。
从四省一路走来考察团发现，已经种下的油菜长势都较为喜人。前期的干旱主要集中在华北地区，并未对这一区域的油菜生产产生不利影响。13―14日，考察团所到地区普降雨雪，气温骤降，但由于雨雪后气温快速回升，低温并没有持续一周以上，所以对油菜生长影响不大。
综合分析，造成油菜种植面积减少的主要原因有以下几点：第一，随着农村的青壮年劳动力逐渐向城镇转移，务农人员越来越少，土地抛荒量上升，需要精耕细作的油菜更易受到影响，原先的移栽种植逐步被撒播取代，亩产和播种面积都难有提高；第二，和小麦等争地作物相比，国家对种油菜的补贴和小麦相比没有提高，效益比处于劣势，种植小麦的积极性更高；第三，随着种子、化肥及人力成本的上涨，种油菜受益较小，按照目前油菜籽2.1元/斤的收购价格，人均两亩田，平均亩产300斤菜籽计算，除去成本，种两亩油菜籽年净收入不足500元，而且油菜难以机械化收割，费时费力，性价比不高；第四，国家每年公布小麦最低收购价往往在播种之前，农民提前可以确定种植收益，而油菜籽收购政策往往在四月份才出台，此时油菜早已播种，即将进入收获期，农民在播种时缺乏指引，面临很大不确定性，一定程度上挫伤了农户油菜种植积极性。
油菜籽加工产业之忧
油菜种植面积的减少给油菜产业发展带来了较大影响。考察团走访的10家企业，均不同程度地面临菜籽源有限、企业争抢激烈、行业压榨能力过剩的情况。传统从事菜籽油加工的大企业逐渐转向依靠进口菜籽或加工大豆、棉籽来弥补国内菜籽加工量不足，这决定了未来我国油脂供应会更多样化，而菜油所占比重还有下降的可能。小企业面临的市场风险更大，目前更多是以代储加工方式来规避，但今年菜籽收购价从1.95元上涨到2.1元以上这种节节攀高的行情，对代储加工企业而言也将使其承担成本上升带来的亏损。此外，大豆等油料加工从沿海向内地的转移的趋势，必然给原本具有港口优势的沿海油厂的发展带来压力，这也解释了目前沿海油厂豆粕库存较大的原因。在现有政策以及油菜种植趋势下，沿江油脂企业新一轮的兼并重组也将上演。
应对之策
为了提高国内食用油自给率，菜籽作为国产原料需要得到保护，对于提高菜籽的种植积极性有如下几点建议：首先从源头上要保障供应，即提高农民的种植积极性，通过直补等方式，直接使农民受益，避免流通环节价格翻倍而农民难以从中受益的情况。第二，扶植龙头企业，发挥优势企业的带头作用，逐步探索尝试“订单农业”，通过建立合作社的方式，从原料上保障产业链的发展，并加大对企业科研项目及设备、技术改造的支持。第三，国家要更多地发挥市场化手段的调节作用，避免过多的价格干预和对油菜籽价格进行限制。第四，在政策方面，适当调整油菜籽与小麦、稻米的比价关系，提高农民的种植积极性，并逐步掌握油菜籽、菜粕的定价权。第五，地方政府应大力支持与引导，统一品种，统一种植，统一收割，合理分配资源。

description.hltext_display: 日本央行12月份维持对国内经济的评估不变
description.content:
投稿 打印 转发 MSN推荐 博客引用 分享到搜狐微博 分享到新浪微博
发布到 MySpace.cn
本央行(Bank of Japan) 12月份维持对国内经济的评估不变，称尽管有经济温和复苏的迹象，但国内经济复苏似乎出现停滞。
日本央行在周三发布的月度经济报告中表示，日本经济可能会在一段时间内以较慢速度增长，但其后预计将回归到温和复苏的轨道上。
日本央行称，近来生产活动略有下降，同时商业信心也有些疲软，制造业尤其如此。
本文由道琼斯通讯社提供，获取更丰富更及时的道琼斯财经资讯，请访问WWW.DJCNEWS.COM。

description.hltext_display: iPad helps hospital treat patients in Israel
description.content:
TEL AVIV: A hospital in Israel has begun using Apple's iPad to enable medical staff to help treat patients, provide consultations and study X-rays and CT scans from afar.
The Mayanei Hayeshua Medical Center, located in the largely ultra-orthodox Tel Aviv suburb Bnei Brak, said on Tuesday it is the first hospital to program the high-resolution, touch-screen iPad to interact with Microsoft Corp's Chameleon software used by hopsitals.
The hospital's computer department programed the iPad with the help of an external technology company.
"We now have the same program and the same database for treatment in the hospital on the iPad," Dr Yoram Liwer, chief executive of Mayanei Hayeshua, told Reuters. "The patients' data are in the computer ... so physicians who are out of hospital but on call can see X-rays and ultrasounds through their iPad and give more intelligent advice to staff in the hospital."
For example, a patient recently arrived in the emergency room with a broken hip and ultimately needed a full hip replacement.
The doctor on duty consulted with a senior orthopeadic surgeon who was not in the hospital and who offered advice on the treatment after studying the X-rays and CT scans. The senior doctor was also able to follow up immediately after the surgery to see the results.
"The high resolution of the screens enables good viewing of the X-rays and also the iPad is fun to work with," Liwer said. "People like to carry it with them wherever they go. They don't take a laptop but the iPad is with them all the time so we get better and more intelligent consulting."

description.hltext_display: 日本预计下一财年经济增长1.5%，通货紧缩何时结束尚无定数
description.content:
投稿 打印 转发 MSN推荐 博客引用 分享到搜狐微博 分享到新浪微博
发布到 MySpace.cn
本政府预计，始于明年4月份的下一财政年度经济增长率将为1.5%，增速将较本财年的3.1%有所放缓，因为预计补贴举措激励下的消费热潮将会消退，而且日圆走强将继续令出口商承压。
日本内阁府(Cabinet Office)周三发布经济展望报告称，预计下一财年实际国内生产总值(GDP)将增长1.5%，名义GDP将增长1.0%。日本政府将本财年GDP增长预期修正为3.1%，这将是三个财年以来日本经济折合成年率首次实现增长。
日本政府还预计下一财年消费者价格指数(CPI)将与当前财年持平。日本首相菅直人(Naoto Kan)今年6月份上任时曾表示，致力于到2011财年结束通货紧缩局面；不过，日本官员表示，对CPI升幅为零的预期并不意味着政府预计会在明年宣布通货紧缩局面结束。
不过，上述预期数据明年可能会被向下修正，因为日本政府将调整数据统计方法。
预计下一财年失业状况将继续缓慢改善，失业率将从目前的5.0%降至4.7%。
这份经济展望报告并未反映上周日本政府批准税改政策的影响。税改政策中包括将企业税率下调5个百分点。

description.hltext_display: 日本政府12月份维持对经济的评估不变
description.content:
本政府12月份维持对国内经济的评估不变，但对经济前景略感乐观，预计短期内国内经济有望摆脱近来的低迷态势。
日本政府在周三发布的报告中称，最近日本经济一直表现不振，并面临着高失业率等严峻问题。这是日本政府连续第三个月持类似看法。
日本政府表示，可能会在未来数月考虑上调对国内经济的评估，因为阻碍经济增长的负面影响已出现减缓迹象。
最值得一提的是，企业对工业产值抱有乐观预期。日本10月份工业产值连续第五个月下滑，但企业预计11月和12月的工业产值将会上升。
一位政府官员在有关该报告的简短新闻发布会上称，如果11月和12月的工业产值出现增长，则可能意味着日本经济将走出低迷。
企业乐观地预计国内汽车消费需求将逐步回暖，因为政府刺激性措施到期带来的一次性负面影响有所缓解。
该官员称，有鉴于此，政府将密切关注未来几个月的消费支出情况，观察汽车需求是否已经触底。
与此同时，日本政府下调了对出口的预期，称亚洲需求下降导致日本出口正“逐步下滑”，而11月份报告的描述是出口正在“走软“。
但日本政府表示对此并不感到特别担心，因为鉴于全球经济仍呈复苏势头，预计来自亚洲的需求将会反弹。
日本政府还下调了对进口的预期，称进口“持平”，而此前报告则称“增长动能正在减弱”。企业景气状况预期也被调低，称企业“对经济前景持谨慎态度”，此前称企业景气状况“正在改善”。日本政府还下调了对破产案情况的评估，称破产案件数量“正在上升”，此前为“持平”。

description.hltext_display: Govt committed to 2015 MDG’s
description.content:
GOVERMNMENT has said it is committed to meeting the 2015 Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) by continued improvement of access of safe drinking water and good sanitation in the country.
Local Government and Housing Permanent Secretary Timothy Hakuyu said yesterday in Masaiti after the National Water Supply and Sanitation 7th Steering Committee Meeting comprised of permanent secretaries from Government ministries and departments toured boreholes and sanitation projects in the district.
Mr Hakuyu said safe drinking water and good sanitation were key to improved health, which is why the Government had embarked on various projects throughout the country.
He said with improved safe drinking water and sanitation, it was possible to meet the 2015 MDGs.
“Matters of safe drinking water sanitation are very important. We have a duty to preserve hygiene,” he said.
And Copperbelt Permanent Villie Lombanya disclosed a total of 390 bole holes are being drilled through out the Copperbelt.
In a speech read on his behalf by Copperbelt Deputy Permanent Secretary Christopher Mutembo, he said the number of new bole holes exceeded that of existing ones; raising the provincial rural water coverage from 20 per cent to 53 per cent, which he said was a significant increase.
He said maintenance and operations systems are being set in place to ensure maximum benefit from water facilities being installed in the province.
“Villagers are being taught how to maintain and repair the hand pumps. Spares are going to made available in the districts through the establishment of spare parts shops,” he said.
He said an approach called Community Led Total Sanitation (CLTS) is being used to improve the sanitation situation in the province.
“About six villages are now open defecation free, because all the villages have latrines. This is expected to contribute towards the reduction of diseases associated with poor sanitation,” Mr Lombanya said.
The permanent secretaries where in Masaiti to sample the implemantion of National Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Programme (NRWSSP).
Today, they be winding up their meeting and the minister of Local Government Housing is expected to launch the prepaid metering project being undertaken by Kafubu Water Sewerage Company in Ndola’s Chifubu area.

description.hltext_display: Rice grower receives conservation award
description.content:
Rice grower Al Montna of Yuba City is the 2010 recipient of the Leopold Conservation Award in California.
The award was announced recently by the California Farm Bureau Federation, San Francisco-based Sustainable Conservation and Wisconsin-based Sand County Foundation.
The $10,000 award, which honors conservationist Aldo Leopold, is presented annually in eight states to private landowners who practice "exemplary land stewardship and management."
Montna oversees Montna Farm in Sutter County, which grows more than 2,500 acres of short-grain rice. His operation used varied conservation practices, including habitat for waterfowl and a solar power facility. � Mark Glover

description.hltext_display: itoiletstand for iPads, Tablets and Other Electronic Devices Coming in 2011
description.content:
Angled Stand or also called by some the itoiletstand is set to launch in 2011 to aid users of ipads, tablets and other electronic devices. The floor stand is patent pending and has an adjustable top and bottom and adjustable stem where the height can be adjusted as well as putting the
stand at different angles. Stay tuned to the website at http://www.angledstand.com or http://www.itoiletstand.com for more information on the features, pricing and dates of availability. "A majority of people do some reading while on the toilet so we expect more reading in the future to be done over ipads™, tablets and electronic readers. This started out as the perfect hands free toilet stand. However, you might need several of these for different parts of the house whether it is next to you in bed, by the couch, next to the bath or even in the kitchen for getting recipes off the computer. There are many uses for ready musical sheet music to uses in presentations and to unique uses in hospitals. “Also if you are like me, I can’t type on the these new ipads and tablets very well for long emails so this stand is perfect if you hook up a wireless keyboard to your device. To help us grow this worldwide, we are looking for some additional investors," says Brian Wall, developer of the stand.
